description: Golden chamomile (Anthemis tinctoria ‘Charme’) is a beautiful, low-growing flowering herb that blooms from June to October with many clusters of daisy-like, bright yellow flowers. This hardy and drought-resistant plant creates a great low-maintenance groundcover, making it perfect for both ornamental and culinary garden designs. In addition, its strong aroma is both natural insect repellent and can be used for teas, soaps, and lotions. Golden Chamomile’s ability to enhance the flavour of recipes, medicinal properties, and delightful appearance make it an amazing addition to any garden.
